meanings.definition: Capable of being changed or modified.
meanings.sent1: The color of the walls is alterable with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: The alterable schedule allowed for last-minute changes.
meanings.sent3: The alterable recipe turned out to be a delicious experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her alterable mood was like a stormy sky, constantly shifting.
meanings.sent5: The alterable weather made planning a picnic a risky endeavor.

meanings.definition: Able to be altered or adjusted.
meanings.sent1: The alterable straps on the backpack made it comfortable to carry.
meanings.sent2: The alterable settings on the thermostat kept the room at a perfect temperature.
meanings.sent3: The alterable seatbelt saved the day in a sudden stop.
meanings.sent4: His alterable voice could mimic any accent with ease.
meanings.sent5: The alterable fabric of the dress allowed for a custom fit.
